result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Frank Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Michigan sentences currently serving

superMiscConds.notes:
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge.

No contact with any minors under 18 without prior agent approval.
No possession or use of Internet capable devices without agent approval.
No possession of any pictures or images of children - except pictures of own children or grandchildren.

Comply with WI Sex Offender Registry Program.
Complete sex offender treatment and follow through.
Iphone is forfeited and will be destroyed.
Comply with all assessments as deemed necessary by agent.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Michigan sentences currently serving

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Frank Harris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel Frank Harris in court with attorney George Steve Pappas.  Defendant Daniel Frank Harris in custody.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10am
Atty Pappas spks on PSI corrections
Parties quesiton JOC from Michigan convictions---believes sentences there are concurrent
Court recesses to review letters 10:09am
Recess concludes 10:11am
ADA spks on sentencing
Atty Pappas spks on sentencing
Def addresses the court
Court is being heard on sentencing
Court imposes: 5 years initial confinement, 10 years extended supervision- consecutive to MI sentences currently serving. Not eligible for CIP or SAP.
Conditions:
Remit fines and costs- except $500 child pornography surcharge and DNA surcharge
Give DNA sample
Iphone is forfeited and will be destroyed
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms 
Comply with WI Sex Offender Registry Program
No contact with any minors under 18 without prior agent approval
Complete sex offender treatment and follow through
No possession or use of Internet capable devices without agent approval
No possession of any pictures or images of child- except pictures of own children or grandchildren
Comply with all asessments as deemed necessary by agent
Def remains in custody of MSD for transport
Appeal rights
